titles.title: Snow Removal Policy Act of 1996
Snow Removal Policy Act of 1996
To direct the President to establish standards and criteria for the provision of major disaster and emergency assistance in response to snow-related events.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee on Water Resources and Environment Discharged.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 104-792.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 430.

action.text: Mr. Shuster moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/18/1996--Passed House amended. Snow Removal Policy Act of 1996 - Requires the President, through the Director of the Federal Emergency Management Agency, to promulgate standards and criteria for declaring a major disaster or emergency under the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act in response to a snow-related event and for providing assistance under the Act for such an event, including reimbursement for snow and debris removal and emergency protective measures.
